thread.title: Daniel Sturridge injury 'not too bad' reveals Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool striker limps off at Sunderland
thread.title_full: Daniel Sturridge injury 'not too bad' reveals Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool striker limps off at Sunderland

author: irishmirror
title: Daniel Sturridge injury 'not too bad' reveals Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool striker limps off at Sunderland
text:
Sport Daniel Sturridge injury 'not too bad' reveals Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool striker limps off at Sunderland Sturridge limped off with ten minutes remaining with what appeared to be an ankle injury after being caught by Sunderland defender Papy Djilobodji Share Daniel Sturridge limped off against Sunderland (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jurgen Klopp moved to allay fears that Daniel Sturridge is set for yet another lengthy spell on the sidelines. 
England striker Sturridge limped off with ten minutes remaining against Sunderland with what appeared to be an ankle injury after being caught by defender Papy Djilobodji 
But Klopp suggested after the game that the injury isn't as bad as feared. 
“He had a knock on his right ankle. I don't think it is too bad,” he told the Liverpool Echo. 
There was less positive news on the health of James Milner and Jordan Henderson, however. View gallery 
Milner failed to emerge for the second half while Henderson didn't face his former club having suffered a heel problem during Saturday's win over Manchester City. 
“It felt like he (Milner) got a knock on this calf, but he didn't know exactly,” said Klopp. “So we had to be really careful. That's why we changed him.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
